Smilodon, Homotherium

This white-furred cat has short forelegs in comparisons to its loping rear legs. Prominent fangs protrude from its upper jaw.


Homotherium

CR 5

XP 1,600
N Medium animal
Init +2; Senses low-light vision; Perception +9
DEFENSE
AC 15, touch 12, flat-footed 13 (+2 Dex, +3 natural)
hp 51 (6d8+24)
Fort +9, Ref +7, Will +3
OFFENSE
Spd 40 ft.
Melee bite +10 (1d6+6 plus grab plus bleed), 2 claws +10 (1d4+6 plus grab)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
Special Attacks bleed (1), pounce, rake (2 claws +10, 1d4+6)
STATISTICS
Str 23, Dex 15, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
Base Atk +4; CMB +10 (+14 grapple); CMD 22 (26 vs. trip)
Feats Power Attack, Run, Skill Focus (Perception)
Skills Acrobatics +10, Perception +9, Stealth +11 (+15 in snowy areas), Swim +10; Racial Modifiers +4 Acrobatics, +4 Stealth (+8 in snowy areas)
ECOLOGY
Environment cold forests and plains
Organization solitary, pair or den (6-10)
Treasure none

This white-furred saber-toothed cat is a relative of the smilodon but makes its home in the arctic regions of the world. Its canines are much shorter than the smilodon (averaging only about 4-5 inches long) and its front legs are longer than its rear legs (similar to a hyena's leg structure).
